newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: PRESS DIGEST - Czech Republic - Oct 18.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Czech Republic - Oct 18.

text.p: HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - Buying up of the loss-making credits of smaller Czech banks will cost the state 13.7 billion crowns. According to central bank Governor Josef Tosovsky, the money will be drawn from Konsolidacni Banka.
- During the first nine months of 1996 Ceska Zbrojovka, an arms factory, increased its exports by 21 percent year-on-year.

- A new car, the Tatra Beta, was introduced on an international exhibition Autoshow Prague '96. The manufacturer of this car is Skoda Tatra and starting November 1, the car will be sold for 259,000 crowns.
MLADA FRONTA DNES - The new GSM mobile phones often disappoint their owners. RadioMobil's Paegas system does not cover an area of four towns in the originally advertised range.

- The price stability of agricultural products and foods should be, according to Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus, the aim of a new system which would replace the Market Regulation Fund. The agricultural market needs a completely different system of price regulation.

PRAVO - The cabinet decided to give financial support to engineering company CKD Praha Holding on Wednesday. The state can remove all the company's debts and the company will save several billion crowns.

- According to Finance Minister Ivan Kocarnik, the state debt of the Czech Republic belongs to the smallest in the world. In 1996 it reached 154.4 billion crowns and it should be reduced to 149 billion in 1997.
